snippet: The three were said to be taken by “unknown people” who broke open the doors of their residences in an area near the Nigerian border that is known for kidnappings.
abstract: Italian government and Vatican officials report that Italian priests Giampaolo Marta and Gianantonio Allegri and Canadian nun Gilberte Bissiere were abducted from their mission in northern Cameroon by unknown assailants.

byline.contributor: Jim Yardley contributed reporting from Rome, and Adam Nossiter from Dakar, Senegal.

lead_paragraph: The three were said to be taken by “unknown people” who broke open the doors of their residences in an area near the Nigerian border that is known for kidnappings.

headline.main: 2 Italian Priests and a Canadian Nun Are Abducted in Cameroon
headline.print_headline: 2 Italian Priests and a Canadian Nun Are Abducted in Cameroon
